acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to claim.

returns._0: Whether the claim has been made

params._claimEnd: The end time of the claim period.
params._claimStart: The start time of the claim period.
params._token: The address of the token contract.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner.

updateBlacklist(address).details: Only the owner can execute this function

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

withdrawERC20(address).details: Only the owner can execute this function

params._token: The ERC20 token address to withdraw

claim(address,uint256,bytes32[]).notice: Claims the airdrop for the user.

hasClaimed(address,uint256).notice: Check if a claim has been made

isClaimed(bytes32).notice: Mapping of hashes and their claim status

token().notice: The address of the Taiko token contract.

withdrawERC20(address).notice: Withdraw ERC20 tokens from the Vault

documentation.text: @notice The address of the Taiko token contract.
@notice Event emitted when the blacklist is updated.

@notice Modifier to check if the address is not blacklisted.
 @param _address The address to check.
@notice Internal method to authorize an upgrade
